title: Anyone want a bidding partner? Auction ends in about 7 hours
author: Howe’s Hunter

posts.post_title: Anyone want a bidding partner? Auction ends in about 7 hours
posts.post_content:
I'm interested in only the Jordan, and must admit, I'm surprised the bidding has gone up as far as it has for the condition of the cards. But I'd be good for $30 towards whatever the bid might be just for the Jordan. Let me know if you are interested, or if you're bidding and I won't bid again. (ed@edmccollum.com)

Thanks.

[url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/4-1909-T206-Baseball-Cards-Lot-JORDAN-BRIDWELL-MERKLE-TOBACCO-CARDS/352440103547?ssPageName=STRK%3AMEBIDX%3AIT&_trksid=p2055359.m1431.l2649[/url]

Hopefully Ed did, just so he can add to his Howe collection.  And it is laminated to boot!  Note how the two laminated cards are in much nicer condition.  

Count me in as another vote in favor of the lamination of all the cards in your collection faction!  Vote the laminate line this coming November!


Brian

[quote name="brianp-beme" post=1811190]Hopefully Ed did, just so he can add to his Howe collection.  And it is laminated to boot!  Note how the two laminated cards are in much nicer condition.  

Count me in as another vote in favor of the lamination of all the cards in your collection faction!  Vote the laminate line this coming November!


Brian[/QUOTE]

Laminate sucks. :). I have passed over a few gems because of it. That and the super glue from the the 19xx's. There is a great looking 1933 Goudey Ruth on the bay with heavy, clear glue on the back. I shy away from both. So count me as a nay vote. :cool:
